_meta.description: Rules for adapting written text to spoken delivery

parenthetical_to_dash.description: Convert parenthetical asides to em-dashes or separate sentences
parenthetical_to_dash.example_before: The tool (which was available to both) produced different results.
parenthetical_to_dash.example_after: The tool — which was available to both — produced different results.

semicolon_to_period.description: Break semicolon-joined clauses into separate sentences
semicolon_to_period.example_before: The first person found the floor; the second discovered the ceiling.
semicolon_to_period.example_after: The first person found the floor. The second discovered the ceiling.

ellipsis_handling.description: Replace ellipsis with period or natural pause

split_triggers: although it should be noted that
in addition to the fact that

italics.description: Context determines stress; often no change needed
italics.note: TTS handles emphasis through sentence context

bold.description: Usually structural emphasis; may need spoken equivalent
bold.note: Consider adding 'importantly' or similar if emphasis is critical

ALL_CAPS.description: Strong emphasis; preserve meaning through word choice
ALL_CAPS.note: Convert to lowercase but ensure context conveys emphasis
